class.name: AppleFilePicker
class.brief_description: Provides access to the operating system file picker, on iOS, this provides access to sandboxed content.
class.description:
This class provides access to the system's native file picker (`UIDocumentPickerViewController` on iOS, `NSOpenPanel` on macOS). It allows selecting files based on UTTypes (passed as file extensions) and supports both single and multiple file selection.
If your application is running in a sandbox (always the case on iOS, sometimes on MacOS), you need to call the AppleURL methods for starting and stopping access to them.

method.name: pick_document
method.description: Opens the file picker. [param allowed_types] should be an array of strings representing the file extensions or UTTypes you want to allow (e.g. [code]["txt", "png"][/code] or [code]["public.plain-text"][/code]). [param allow_multiple] if true, allows selecting multiple files. Results will be emitted via the [signal files_selected] signal. If false (default), results are emitted via [signal file_selected].

signal.name: canceled
signal.description: Emitted when the picker is canceled by the user.

signal.name: file_selected
signal.description: Emitted when a single file is selected (when [code]allow_multiple[/code] is false).

signal.name: files_selected
signal.description: Emitted when multiple files are selected (when [code]allow_multiple[/code] is true).
